title: Erro de login no youtube
content:
Faz algum tempo que eu venho enfrentando esse problema no firefox com o youtube, o que acontece é o seguinte, eu faço login no youtube e ele não permanece logado, quando vou curtir algo ou salvar na minha conta não consigo. Quando apertar o botão, mesmo logado, não aparece a lista das playlists para adicionar o vídeo. Além disso, mesmo quando aperto o botão para fazer login no canto superior direito do site, ele ainda aparece como se eu não estivesse logado quando eu clico no menu lateral para visualizar as playlists, etc. Vou deixar um print desse erro em anexo.

Alguém sabe o que é isso? Antes o erro que ocorria apenas no firefox eram os vídeos ficarem apresentando pequenos travamentos durante a exibição.

Obrigado! :D
creator: tauanbalbino

title: Installing the current extended release of Firefox while keeper earlier version
content:
I figured it was high time I installed a more current extended release of Firefox while keeping the current extended release version I have which I need in order to keep certain extensions, like the MAFF format, working.

But when I went to install it (custom install) into its own folder with a different version name, the button which showed up said "upgrade" instead of "install." I DO NOT want this installation to overwrite that earlier version. But that "upgrade" button makes me think that is what is likely to happen. How do I install it without it overwriting the older extended release version I already have installed?

On a different topic, I have learned that Flash will be discontinued at the end of this month. Can anyone tell me how this will impact my browsers? My online banking site uses Flash extensively, and I prefer using Firefox for that site. I'm assuming Chrome, which keeps updating itself automatically no matter what I do to stop it, will accommodate the change. But if I want to keep using that older extended release version of Firefox I have, what is likely to happen?

Thank you,

Dandelion
creator: Larkspur19

title: Downloads
content: Lately, every time I download a photoshop file, it now opens Photoshop and opens the file. How do I disable that from happening? I just want the file. I don't need to see it open. This has just been happening recently and I don't always need to open the files right away. It just slows my progress down and it's annoying! Thank you in advance!

title: Unable to print to PDFFactory from Gmail using Firefox
content:
This past week I have been unable to print an email from Gmail to PDFfactory. It prints so large a two page document uses 15 pages in PDFfactory.

This worked fine last week.

Exchanging emails with FinePrint found I could print from Gmail to PDF when I used Edge. In my business I print a lot of emails to PDF to save in a file and upload to companies I contract with.

I have used Firefox for many years, but if Mozilla can't give me a fix for this issue this weekend, by Sunday night I will be switching over to Chrome. I don't want to, but I am being forced to.

If anyone has a suggestion, please share it.

I wanted to attach an example but cannot find any plain jane emails without personal info.

title: How to limit memory usage per tab
content:
I have problem with webpages with buggy javascript in a few websites. Website consumes all available memory and start to use swap. Swap in my computer is very slow (non-flash) and the computer stops to respond. Only restart can help me. Computer has 6GB RAM but JS on opened site can consume more than 2GB!!! I want to have possibility to set maximum memory used by one tab of firefox (I know, the tab is separated process and it should be possible).

How to limit memory usage by one tab to 750MB (or other value, preferred by user)? Acceptable actions after trying to get more memory: - the JS can stop to work, - the tab will show that crashed, - the tab will be closed automatically, - require confirmation before allowing any more allocations.

How to set it in about:config?

If it is not possible, please report bug and propose other similar function that will fix this problem.

creator: phil.cote

title: VP9 video encoded by AWS MediaConvert will play in Chrome but not Firefox
content:
I have recently used AWS MediaConvert to create a webm video file using the VP9 codec.

This file will play for me locally using VLC and ffplay. It will also play in Chrome (either locally or from the web).

However it will not play in Firefox. Error is "Video cannot be played because the file is corrupt" and the console shows "Media resource http://s3-eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/lg-watch/ff-test_fromaws.webm could not be decoded, error: Error Code: NS_ERROR_DOM_MEDIA_FATAL_ERR (0x806e0005)"

But if I encode the same file via VP9 codec using ffmpeg then the file will play perfectly in firefox.

Using mediainfo to examine the files I cannot see any difference in them. Can anyone help me understand what is preventing the AWS video from playing?

Test files:

(this is the one that won't play, encoded using AWS Mediaconvert with default settings for VP9/webm) http://s3-eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/lg-watch/ff-test_fromaws.webm

(this is the one that will play, encoded using ffmpeg with default settings - -c:v libvpx-vp9 -b:v 2M) http://s3-eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/lg-watch/ff-test-from_ffmpeg.webm

Firefox v83 (Fedora 33, Wayland)
creator: donald_i

title: Macbook pro crashed, firefox suddenly won't launch
content:
Hi everybody I really hope you can help me!

I have a mid 2012 macbook pro, it is old, but it has been working with no problem. I recently updated the HD cable and the harddisk to a SSD. I mainly use firefox as my internet browser and I would like to continue to do so.

Today my macbook crashed, it does so sometimes, but it always restarts with no problem - my firefox too: reopening all my tabs - it is not unusual for me to have 20 tabs open at the same time.

Today my macbook crashed and restarted, but when I pressed to reopen the firefox app, nothing happened. The little dot that shows, when a macbook application is open, shows for a second or two, but then disappears as if firefox is trying to open, but then shuts down. I tried holding down alt/option key down while starting firefox, but to no awail. How do I fix this?

I thought the app maybe needed to update, so I went to download firefox again (through google chrome browser). A new firefox application was then created - 'firefox 2' open with no problem, but I'm not signed in.

I can sign in now, but I can't sync - this is due to another unrelated problem concerning my firefox account email, which I haven't updated in due time - the email-domain I had used for my primary email (@sol.dk) has been terminated. This means ALL my saved passwords, my bookmarks, my search histrory - everthing is lost.

Does anybody have a clue how to solve this primary and secondary problem? 1) Why is my original firefox application for macbook suddenly not working? Is this fixable? 2) If it is not fixable, is there anyway mozilla/firefox can help me retrieve my firefox account with all my passwords and so on? Seems like I have been locked out.

Thank you so very much in advance! Kind regards!
creator: blomstergirl

Thanks

title: Firefox desktop on Ubuntu and Windows says "server not found" trying to connect to cdc.gov!
content:
Running Firefox on Ubuntu 20.04, Windows 10, and Android 11. versions 83.0, 83.0, and 83.1.0 respectively.

As of 12/10/2020 discovered that on Ubuntu 20.04 Firefox would not get to cdc.gov and gave message "server not found".

On 12/11/2020 I started digging a bit deeper.

  • Firefox on the Ubuntu and Windows hosts, both on home WiFi (Optimum, public IP 24.47.128.216) does not get to cdc.gov with message "server not found".
  • Firefox on Android 11 (WiFi connected and LTE at 3 bars) does connect to cdc.gov. Don't know how to tell if connection via WiFi or LTE.
  • Firefox on Ubuntu and Windows hosts using USB tethering to phone for Internet does not connect to cdc.gov.
  • Chrome 87.0.4280.88 and Chromium 87.0.4280.88 on Ubuntu and Windows hosts on home WiFi connect to cdc.gov
  • Edge 87.0.664.60 on Windows host on home WiFi connects to cdc.gov

Seems Firefox desktop for Ubuntu and Windows is having some kind of problem with cdc.gov. Have tried running in Safe Mode and selecting Restart with add ons disabled and Refresh Firefox. Neither option has resolved problem.

What's wrong?

title: Wordpress 5.6 causes problems when viewing and editing a Wordpress site in Firefox
content:
I administer three Wordpress sites, all of which updated to Wordpress 5.6 two days ago. Since then, I have experienced problems when viewing and editing these sites in Firefox.

The viewing problem is that reCAPTCHA does not work in Firefox - it appears to time out, which prevents a form from being submitted. This problem does not occur when I view the same sites in Chrome and Edge.

The editing problem is that the edit toolbar does not remain fixed in place at the top of the edit window when I scroll down a page but rather scrolls out of sight, which makes it very difficult to apply formatting to the text. Again, this problem does not occur when I edit in Chrome or Edge.

title: INTERNET SECURITY AND BROWSING HISTORY
content:
Hi... I'm not a computer expert by any definition. I know my way around some apps and try to follow computer and internet best practices. I've used Firefox for a couple of years and have been satisfied with it... However lately I've been thinking about how I can ensure that when I communicate on the internet nothing is left on my computer, either where I've been or who / what type of communication has taken place. I perform several financial transactions daily with institutions local and out of country. I know of a very recent issue one person I know had on their PC, They lent it for use to someone they know and they were able find history of communications and email addresses etc. It was a very difficult situation for that person when their email was hacked and websites tracked from a person / persons unknown. I've turned on the Firefox option of deleting all history and cookies and have done that in Windows internet options (at least as far as I can determine). Based on what I've done, is there anywhere on my PC where internet communication is stored that I can remove when I've finished using the internet? My internet provider is Bell.

many thanks BEH

creator: alberto.rampani

title: Which firewall exceptions do I need to define to allow automatic updates?
content:
At work, my work machine keeps getting this message: "Firefox can't update to the latest version. Download a fresh copy of Firefox and we'll help you to install it."

There are several threads found in various blogs of how to get past it. I've tried several to no avail. At this point, I'm thinking about if there needs to be a firewall exception added by our network administrator to allow updates to automatically download firefox updates. A previous thread asked this question, but I'm not clear if the answer is what I think it is. The answer suggested says to here's the thread:

"The update URL is generated via the app.update.url pref that you can inspect on the about:config page." The app.update.url says this: https://www.mozilla.org/%LOCALE%/firefox/. Is that what we need to put in? If so, why didn't the answer just say that?

The next part of the answer suggests downloading and installing a Live HTTP Headers extension, then going to Help about firefox. I did this, but nothing populated the extension.

This may seem like two problems posted here, I can repost the error as a separate issue if desired and we can address what exceptions here.

Thank you very much for any help you can give.

Mike
creator: indianamichael1

title: All Firefox downloads come up as "File Missing or Moved"
content:
For the last few weeks, every time I try to download a file, doesn't matter the format, if I chose "open with", it acts like it downloads. However, when you check the downloads, it just reads {filename} - File moved or missing. And it doesn't show up in my downloads folder.

If i select the option to save it first, then i get the downloaded file and can open it.

I've uninstalled Firefox multiple times, reinstalled, tested with both the normal public installer and the enterprise msi installer. I run no extensions or plugins beyond what's there by default. I've deleted the default profile, created a new profile. Tested in safe mode.


Though i can still get what i need, it's a little cumbersome when i have to download a bunch of default reports or files with generic names and clutter my downloads folder.
creator: rrice2004

title: Youtube carga eternamente (Firefox)
content:
Hola, Cuando entro a Youtube, se lanza y relanza la página automáticamente, es decir a cargarse y no para nunca. Tampoco puedo ver vídeos concretos ni incrustados en ningún foro, de hecho ni se cargan los vídeos o si te rediriges empieza a cargarse la página una y otra vez. Harto de ello me he decidido a abrir este post para ver si a alguien más le pasa o a ver cuál sería la posible solución, sin tener que recurrir a Chrome. Lo que he ido probando es, desde el menú opciones de Firefox, en Rendimiento a quitar la configuración de rendimiento recomendada (https://support.mozilla.org/es/kb/aj...urce=inproduct). También en su sub-menú a quitar la aceleración de hardware cuando esté disponible (he probado con todas esas opciones) y tampoco funciona, evidentemente en cada prueba he reiniciado Firefox. Posteriormente y viendo que no funcionaba nada, me dispuse a quitar todos los AD-Block que tengo, que son dos, el ABP (AdBlockPlus) y el AdBlock normal. Probé a quitar uno, dejar otro, quitar otro dejar uno, quitar ambos, etc. Absolutamente NADA. He googleado un poco más pero no hay información suficiente, o la que aporta ahora mismo Firefox en su soporte no es nada relevante para este problema, además que es lo primero que miré del rendimiento.

He probado también en InternetExplorer11 y en Edge, y funciona perfectamente Youtube (comiéndote anuncios cada 30 segundos claro), es decir, tema de rendimiento del ordenador tampoco creo que sea un problema. Tampoco es problema de Cookies ni caché, limpié todo y tampoco funciona. Tampoco funciona Firefox Nightly. Tampoco funciona en otros dispositivos (Ubuntu Firefox).

¿Sabe alguien de dónde puede venir este problema?
creator: xkri82

title: Why is this cross site XHR request blocked?
content:
Using Firefox 83.0 on Windows 7 and Windows 10, no plugins or extensions installed.

  • I open a HTML page on server https://secure...
  • The page successfully loads lots of scripts and other resources from server https://deimos...
  • When using an XHR request to access an ODATA resource on https://deimos... the request is marked as "blocked" in DevTools, see screenshot
  • When hovering the "blocked" icon in the console, "blocked by DevTools" is displayed
  • The page works fine in Chromium based browsers (tested Edge, Chrome, Firefox)
  • The page works fine if it is hosted on https://deimos... instead of https://secure... (that's why I assume that it is some Cross-Origin issue)
  • The server provides Access-Control-* headers, see screenshot. The headers provided for the blocked XHR request are the same if I check them in the chromium based browsers.
  • There is no sign (like a pre-flight OPTIONS request) of the blocked request in the web server logs
  • Only requestr which use credentials are blocked. Other XHR-requests without credentials (like the one following the blocked request on the screenshot) seem to succeed.

I played around with the "Content-Security-Policy" meta tag in the document, with no success. For requests blocked by this policy, DevTools explicitly displayed the Content Security Policy as the reason for blocking the request.

I found lots of posts on the net concerning the Access-Control-Allow-Credentials header, also I found that for requests with credentials the Access-Control-Allow-Origin header must not return "*". IMHO those are correctly provided by my server.

Any idea of what is going wrong here? I can provide the link to access the page in a personal mail...

Kind regards Ted
creator: ted+firefox

title: CCTV systems with Network Video Recorder (NVR) over cat6a PoE
content:
Hi,

I have been designing a Hikvision CCTV system and bumped into a problem. Mac users cannot use a browser to access all the various controls and settings as Hikvision rely upon ActiveX, which is old and a security risk. I am informed that this problem exists in the whole CCTV industry! I am advised that Hikvision will eventually dump ActiveX in favour of HTML5, but this seems to require a new operating system!

I think it's incredible that a whole industry should build itself upon one piece of legacy. Surely browsers would be the way to go. That way online acccess to a CCTV system would be OS independent. Does onyone have some thoughts on this?

Why not implement an HTML5 plugin?

I'm no expert, but have been around computer tech since the early 1980s.

Comments/observations much appreciated.

Regards Michael

title: Suppress auto printing
content: Apparently it is possible to write a web page such that it pops up the printer dialogue on load. That is, something in the page automatically launches the print dialogue. Usually that is wanted/expected behavior. For example, you just clicked on a "Print" button on the page. In my case, there is one page I use a lot that tries to auto-print a PDF. But I have PDF's set to open outside of FireFox. So the PDF loads in Acrobat (expected behavior), and FireFox tries to print the HTML page that is open in FireFox. Also presumably expected behavior, but not wanted if it is the PDF I want to print. This has gotten annoying, and so I'm looking for a control that suppresses printing. Ten minutes of googleing and all I can find are articles for the control to suppress the dialogue for printing, and instead print directly to the default printer, ie silent printing. I don't want to suppress the dialog. I want to auto-cancel the print job. That is, I want to disallow a web page from invoking the print dialog at all, by overriding the print instruction. Such as setting could either be set for a specific page, set or globally; either would work for me. Is there a control for that?

title: Al cerrar el navegador o la página web, Firefox me cierra sesión automáticamente ¿cómo puedo evitar esto?

Esto me pasa con Facebook, Twitter, Instagram y con Linkedin. Es muy molesto tener que ir logueandome cada vez que cierro una pestaña, es más, me pasa hasta con Google, porque algunas veces al cerrar la pestaña de Google, si vuelvo a entrar en Google me pide otra vez que acepte los términos de acuerdo de Google. ¿Cómo puedo evitar esto, es la primera vez que me pasa una cosa así desde que uso Firefox?
